docs.snippet: WEEK ENDED AUG. 2, 1941 Business in the foreign exchange market last week passed over without incident, price changes and turnover being small and the already sluggish condition of the market being abetted by the elimination of the Japanese and...
docs.lead_paragraph: WEEK ENDED AUG. 2, 1941 Business in the foreign exchange market last week passed over without incident, price changes and turnover being small and the already sluggish condition of the market being abetted by the elimination of the Japanese and Shanghai currencies through the "freezing" order of President Roosevelt at the preceding week-end.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 -- Ignoring Germany, Japan and Italy, but conferring with the American republics concerned, the United States Government has suspended for the duration of the present emergency the International Load Line Convention, signed at...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 -- Ignoring Germany, Japan and Italy, but conferring with the American republics concerned, the United States Government has suspended for the duration of the present emergency the International Load Line Convention, signed at London on July 5, 1930.

headline.main: REPORT ON SOUTH AMERICA; By an American observer who visited ten countries and found our growing military might is beginning to count. FOCAL POINTS IN THE SOUTH AMERICAN PICTURE Old ties to Europe loosen and new bonds to us grow as we rise in military might and world leadership.
